label: A2BC4_oP28_60_d_c_2d-001
title: $E3_{2}$ (CaB$_{2}$O$_{4}$ I) Structure
comments:
CaB$_{2}$O$_{4}$ exists in at least four phase (Marezio, 1969): \begin{itemize} \item The ground state, stable below 1.2 GPa, {\em Strukturbericht} $E3_{2}$ (this structure) \item Orthorhombic high pressure structure, stable between 1.2 and 1.5 GPa, presumably \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_oP56_56_2e_e_4e-001}{Calciborite} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_oP84_33_6a_3a_12a-001}{Orthorhombic high pressure structure}, stable between 1.5 and 2.5 GPa \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_cP84_205_d_ac_2d-001}{Cubic high pressure structure}, stable between 2.5 and 4.0 GPa \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.35in} 
 (Marezio, 1963) gives the crystal structure in the Pnca setting of space group \#60.  We have used FINDSYM to transform this to the standard Pbcn setting.
